items.title: Introduction to Generative AI
items.author: Srikar Prabhas Kandagatla
items.description:
Generative AI has rapidly transformed how we create and engage with content, enabling the generation of images, text, music, and more. By using advanced algorithms, this technology produces new data based on existing patterns, unlocking new possibilities across various industries. In this article, we will define Generative AI (Gen AI), distinguish it from traditional models, and highlight its key applications.

Generative AI (Gen AI)

Generative AI refers to models that can produce new data based on a given training set. These models can generate various outputs, such as images, text, and audio.

“Generative” refers to the model’s ability to create new content. In contrast, “discriminative models,” commonly used for classification tasks like brain tumor or Alzheimer’s disease detection, focus on distinguishing between categories (e.g., multi-class classification in supervised learning).

Generative models, however, can produce new data from various inputs, such as unstructured data. Popular examples include Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) for images and models like ChatGPT, Google Gemini, and Meta Llama for natural language generation.

Large Language Model (LLM)

Another key term for Generate AI is “Large Language Model” (LLM). LLMs or Generative AI are also called “Multi-Modal” because they can handle various tasks, including text-to-text, text-to-image, and image-to-text generation.

To simplify, an LLM (Large Language Model), also known as Gen AI or a multi-modal model, is a versatile tool capable of performing various tasks across domains such as NLP and computer vision, including text generation, chatbot creation, summarization, and translation.

Summary

Generative AI models create new data, such as images or text, from various inputs. Unlike discriminative models, which classify data, generative models produce new content. Large Language Models (LLMs) are versatile tools that handle tasks like text and image generation, translation, and summarization leveraging deep learning algorithms.

In the next article, we will discuss the Gen AI pipeline.

Get in Touch

GitHub: https://github.com/srikarkandagatla
